sub_topic: Probability of rolling a certain number on a dice
message_1: What is the probability of rolling an odd number on a single fair six-sided dice?
message_2:
There are three odd numbers (1, 3, and 5) on a six-sided dice. The probability of rolling an odd number is the ratio of the number of odd outcomes to the total number of possible outcomes. In this case, there are 3 odd outcomes and 6 total outcomes, so the probability is:

P(odd number) = (number of odd outcomes) / (total number of outcomes) = 3/6 = 1/2 or 50%.
